title: Spout cup
marks:
Mark

Crest of Apthorp is engraved on cover.
text: Spout cups were probably used in colonial America to feed invalids.  This early example, made by the prolific Boston silversmith John Coney, is one of only two known American spout cups with a domed lid.
description: spout cup, with globular body and domed lid with turned finial; reeding at neck and beaded rat tail on handle; engraved crest, much worn, on cover
creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell
